Annotation.String: A collection of volumes grouped together to ensure write order consistency across all those volumes.

A collection of volumes grouped together to ensure write order consistency across all those volumes. A management operation on a consistency group, such as configuring replication properties, applies to all the volumes within the consistency group.
ConsistencyGroup resources can be updated to change the writable properties.
ConsistencyGroup resources can be deleted by deleting the ConsistencyGroup resource.
Requested operations are either triggered or instituted without regard to pending IO.
Orchestration exists to either flush or halt pending IO to ensure operations occur in a transactionally consistent manner.
Supports consistency method commonly orchestrated using application-specific code.
Supports VMware consistency requirements, such as for VASA and VVOLs.
Supports Microsoft virtual backup device interface (VDI).
Supports Microsoft VSS.
Supports consistency method orchestrated using vendor-specific code.
WIP v1.1.0
A collection of volumes grouped together to ensure write order consistency across all those volumes.

A collection of volumes grouped together to ensure write order consistency across all those volumes. A management operation on a consistency group, such as configuring replication properties, applies to all the volumes within the consistency group.
This value is true when the consistency group is in a consistent state.
The value of this property shall be set to true when the consistency group is in a consistent state.
The consistency method used by this group.
The property shall set the consistency method used by this group.
The consistency type used by this group.
This property shall set the consistency type used by this group.
The property contains the status of the ConsistencyGroup.
The property shall contain the status of the ConsistencyGroup.
Describes this storage group in its role as a target for replication.
This property shall describe the replication relationship between this storage group and a corresponding source storage group.
The resources that are target replicas of this source.
The value shall reference the target replicas that are sourced by this replica.
Volumes in this storage group.
An array of references to volumes managed by this storage group.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This structure shall contain references to resources that are not contained within this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The replica update mode (synchronous vs asynchronous).
This parameter shall specify the replica update mode.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing consistency group.
The type of replica relationship to be created (e.g., Clone, Mirror, Snap).
This parameter shall contain the type of replica relationship to be created.
This action is used to establish a replication relationship by assigning an existing consistency group to serve as a target replica for an existing source consistency group.
This action shall be used to establish a replication relationship by assigning an existing consistency group to serve as a target replica for an existing source consistency group.
The replica update mode (synchronous vs asynchronous).
This parameter shall specify the replica update mode.
The Name for the new target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Name for the target consistency group.
The Uri to the existing target Storage Pool.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing StoragePool in which to create the target consistency group.
The type of replica relationship to be created (e.g., Clone, Mirror, Snap).
This parameter shall contain the type of replica relationship to be created.
This action is used to create a new consistency group resource to provide expanded data protection through a replica relationship with the specified source consistency group.
This action shall be used to create a new consistency group resource to provide expanded data protection through a replica relationship with the specified source consistency group.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing target consistency group.
Indicate whether or not to delete the target consistency group as part of the operation.
This parameter shall indicate whether or not to delete the target consistency group as part of the operation. If not specified, the system should use its default behavior.
This action is used to disable data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, remove the replication relationship, and optionally delete the target consistency group.
This action shall be used to disable data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, remove the replication relationship, and optionally delete the target consistency group.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This action is used to resume the active data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, without otherwise altering the replication relationship.
This action shall be used to resume the active data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, without otherwise altering the replication relationship.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This action is used to reverse the replication relationship between a source and target consistency group.
This action shall be used to reverse the replication relationship between a source and target consistency group.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This action is used to split the replication relationship and suspend data synchronization between a source and target consistency group.
This action shall be used to split the replication relationship and suspend data synchronization between a source and target consistency group.
The Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This parameter shall contain the Uri to the existing target consistency group.
This action is used to suspend active data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, without otherwise altering the replication relationship.
This action shall be used to suspend active data synchronization between a source and target consistency group, without otherwise altering the replication relationship.
This version was created to update the reference to StorageReplicaInfo to version 1.3.0. It also adds Redfish.Release annotations.
